artist: Artist: Attributed to Bernardo Strozzi; Artist: Attributed to Giovanni Battista Caracciolo
description: solider wearing a helmet, looking up to PL; curly hair; bulbous nose; wearing armored collar
medium: Black and white chalk on gray-blue laid paper
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, March 17, 1975, no. 17, as Neapolitan, early 17th century, for £170. Sale, Sotheby's, London, December 5, 1977, no. 76, for £392, to Colnaghi for Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Head of a Helmeted Soldier
